Author: Oliver Westbrook#7752
Content: exactly.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: this is the first viable candidate to use for a nationwide crypto

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: all the other proposed solutions I see are either insecure or unproven or dont exist

Author: Oliver Westbrook#7752
Content: this is so much superior to ethereum proposed sharding

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is much simpler and simpler is much better, yes

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it also costs much less per tx, a lot less

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes it ends up being as secure as BTC

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: sort of a magic trick

Author: Oliver Westbrook#7752
Content: yeah in every way. more secure, faster, scalable, etx

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but this is just one usecase of our contracts tech, we continue to create useful solutions while most other projects have some sort of pie in the sky whitepaper, many describing what we already have

Author: Oliver Westbrook#7752
Content: very true. meanwhile you are getting about 5X the current avg tx speed of Visa, and roughly 50X that of PayPal

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: tx or payments?

Author: Oliver Westbrook#7752
Content: TX per second

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: one tx can have 1 payment or 100+

Author: Oliver Westbrook#7752
Content: visa avg about 1600 i think

Author: Oliver Westbrook#7752
Content: oh right! lol

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: at 100 payments tx, you lose 90% of tx/sec, but gain 100x on payments so a 10x increase in payments / sec

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: 10,000 tx/sec of 1 pay -> 1000 tx/sec of 100 pay = 100,000 payments per second. that is with "only" 64 chains

Author: Oliver Westbrook#7752
Content: ah. need to confirm the numbers on others...but for example i think ether is 20 or so, maybe thatâ€™s old info

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: what is the point for single blockchain throughputs when we can spawn an arbitrary number

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: its like trying to push all car traffic onto a single road. not even govts are that silly. if more road capacity is needed, you just build more roads

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and we dont need some magical maglev vacuum sealed hypersonic roadway. just an old fashioned asphalt road suffices

Author: Oliver Westbrook#7752
Content: haha yes

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: whatever capacity  the hypersonic maglev road can achieve, N asphalt roads will get much better overall traffic throughput

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and be much less expensive

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: there is only one complex/clever part about our scaling and that is the MoMoM, 99% is just bruteforce replication of working blockchain tech.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: I think train track example again suites here instead of roads ğŸ˜„

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: granted, being able to spawn a chain from the command line is pretty cool and what makes it possible to automate

Author: yorklab#7270
Content: If there is no limit (or if it's crazy high), then Komodo should advertise as such. State the actual tested then state what's theoretically possible, because the tested number proves the theory.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the only limit is the number of blockchains the internet can support

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: more chains, more capacity. and we are seeing a linear scaling of capacity per chain, now the bottlenecks have been fied

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: fixed

Author: yorklab#7270
Content: Then Komodo's scaling capability is unlimited. Never heard anybody else state this before, much less prove it.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is limited by the internet's capacity

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: @Oliver Westbrook  If you have any questions for me about the tests design let me know. Its incredibly simple in its function. As james said we just automated a system that allows for spawning unlimited chains and then filling all of their mempools with TX at the same time.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: while it is being notarized

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: yes

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and that also allows the burn protocol to be done at the same time

Author: yorklab#7270
Content: Speaking only of Komodo's capability.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: KMD is needed to create the proofs

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: dPoW must go to KMD chain

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: its only a few hundred KMD per year per chain, so it wont be that much of an effect, until we get 10,000+ chains notarizing

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but considerng that 10,000 chains can be spawned automatically it is just a matter of having the funding to launch a single cluster of 10,000 chains

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: on a separate topic I added: fill or kill, immediate or cancel and good till canceled modes for barterDEX trades, from the alice side. bob automatically makes custom sized utxo for alice so alice just needs to have the utxo for the purchase and the dexfee. it also autosplits if there is only one utxo

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: until these improvements it was running in a hybrid (and silly) config of immediate or cancel for alice but bob was treating it as a fill or kill

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so i think ordermatching will be 10x better now
